PR0407110-d-04-24-07-BNSF.Narrative: C NAMPAM1 10L OPERATING EASTWARD ON MAIN 1 STOPPED AT ASHBY WITH TRACKSIDE WARNING DETECTOR AT MP 314.5 IN ALARM. TRAIN THEN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. INSPECTION FOUND DERAILED CARS AT A SECTION OF TRACK THAT HAD SEVERAL ROAD BED AND RAIL CONDITION ISSUES.  WHEN ENGINE 6028 EAST TRAVERSED OVER THE SWITCHAT ASHBY THE ENGINEER FELY THE ENGINE LEAN TO THE SOUTH AROUND THE GROG AREA.  AT THAT TIME THE ENGINEER DAILED UP THE DISPATCHER TO REPORT A ROUGH CONDITION.  THE TRAIN THEN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  SAME TRACKS TRAIN WAS TRAVELING WAS TESTED BY GEO CAR 16 HOURS PRIOR WITH  NO DEFECTS NOTED.  RAIL DETECTOR HRZ 119 TESTED M1 AND SINGLE (SAME TRACKS TRAIN WAS TRAVELING ON 3/30/07 WITH NO DEFECTS NOTEDAND M2 TO SINGLE ON 4/07 WITH NOT DEFECTS NOTED.  SWITCH WAS UNDERCUT IN 2006 AND HAD NO SURFACE CONDITIONS.  NOTE.  WE HAVE RECOVERED ALL BUT 125 FEET.  TRD OUT OF TOPEKA SPENT 3 DAYS LOOKING AT RAIL AND SWITCH COMPONENTS AND FOUND NOTHING THAT WOULD HAVE CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.  WE ARE STILL MISSING 4 WHEEL, 2 TRUCK SIDES AND 2 BOLSTERS.

DE0715-d-04-08-07-DQE.Narrative: WDL SHOVED 27 CARS UP WEST MAIN ON KCS THEN PROCEEDED SOUTH TO CROSS-OVER SWITCH TO GO INTO TRACK #3TO PICK UP INTERCHANGE. A2007APR1D-d-04-14-07-AO.Narrative: 15 CARS WERE PLACED IN #5 TRACK AT RAWHIDE MINE.  THEY BEGAN TO ROLL DUE TO INSUFFICIENT BRAKES APPLIED.  THEY COUPLED INTO 13 MORE CARS ON #5 TRACK AND KEPT ROLLING. 0141007-d-04-10-07-MVP.Primary Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
0141007-d-04-10-07-MVP.Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
0141007-d-04-10-07-MVP.Narrative:
THE MVP 0001, CREW ENGINEER JEFF HALKER, CONDUCTOR MIKE MESNIER AND BRAKEMAN CLAYTON RYDGIG WAS SHOVING TEN CARS EASTWARD INTO TRACK 1712 IN ORDER TO MAKE A PLANT SWITCH FOR THE 0500 R-6 SPOT. WHILE SHOVING OVER THE 1704 SWITCH AT APPROX. 4 MPH DUE TO A SLOW ORDER, THE 6TH AND 7TH CAR DERAILED BY GOING OVER THE SWITCHPOINT AND THE WHEEL OF THE CAR RIDING OVER THE SWITCHPOINT AND GOING ON THE GROUND. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE SIGNS THAT THE SWITCH WAS PICKED NOR WERE THERE ANY VISIBLE INDICATIONS THAT THE CAR WAS DEFECTIVE CAUSING THE DERAILMENT OF THE CARS. THERE WAS ANOTHER DERAILMENT OVER THE SAME SWITCH ON 3/21/07 INVOVLING THE FURX 1165 WITH THE SAME RESULT HENCE THE SLOW ORDER OVER THE EFFECTED AREA.

WHILE TRAVELING OVER THE AREA IT WAS REPORTED BY THE ENGINEER THAT HE WAS SLOWING ANDTHE TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY BRAKING APPLICATION. UPON INSPECTION BY THE GROUND CREW IT WAS DISCOVERED THE THE TWO CARS CR 240750 AND NS 486068 WERE INDEED DERAILED AND HAD BEEN SHOVED APPROX. 300FT ON THE GROUND CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE NORTH YARD LEAD, TRACK 1705, TRACK 1706, TRACK 1708 AND TRACK 1709. ALSO DAMAGED WERE THE TWO CARS THAT WERE DERAILED.
